p: The specimen of H. officinalis subsp. aristatus, collected in 2017 at Civitaretenga (Italy), was subjected to stereomicroscopic and optical microscopic observation to authenticate the main characteristics described in literature for the subspecies and to identify any other diagnostic elements supporting botanical recognition [ 13]. The specimens collected at Campo di Giove and Navelli (Italy) in 2019 presented similar microscopic and pharmacognostic characters already observed for the first one.
